etymologies: 1960s; earliest use found in MIMS Monthly Index. Apparently from pe- + m- + -ol- + -ine, elements of the systematic name

definitions: A synthetic heterocyclic compound which is a stimulant of the central nervous system and is used to treat fatigue, amphetamine addiction, and other conditions; 2-imino-4-oxo-5-phenyloxazolidine, C₉ H₈ N₂ O₂.
